user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of get_rq_param_unquoted_copy_z:
```c
static size_t
get_rq_param_unquoted_copy_z (const struct MHD_RqDAuthParam *param, char *buf)
{
  size_t len;
  mhd_assert (NULL != param->value.str);
  if (! param->quoted)
  {
    memcpy (buf, param->value.str, param->value.len);
    buf [param->value.len] = 0;
    return param->value.len;
  }

  len = MHD_str_unquote (param->value.str, param->value.len, buf);
  mhd_assert (0 != len);
  mhd_assert (len < param->value.len);
  buf[len] = 0;
  return len;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (! param->quoted)
  {
    memcpy (buf, param->value.str, param->value.len);
    buf [param->value.len] = 0;
    return param->value.len;
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The if-block is conditionally executed at runtime and returns only when param->quoted is false; the subsequent code handles the quoted case, so there is no unreachable code in this fragment. (A hypothetical violation would occur if param->quoted were a compile-time constant always true or if prior logic guaranteed param->quoted could never be false, making the entire if-branch unreachable.)
